abstract: Disc 1 The Lion, the witch and the wardrobe (165 mins, 1989)--Disc 2 Prince Caspian (60 mins, 1990), The Voyage of the Dawn Treader (109 mins, 1990)--Disc 3 The Silver chair (156 mins, 1991)--Disc 4 Special features
description: Episode of Series "The Chronicles of Narnia". A breathtaking live action, made for television rendition of C. S. Lewis' powerful fantasy for all ages using stunning special effects to recreate the most exciting and enchanting adventure of them all. "The Lion, the witch and the wardrobe": four children, sent from London into the countryside during the dangerous period of WW2, discover the magical world of Narnia - where dwarves, nymphs and giants reside, fauns carry umbrellas, animals talk and horses fly. It is also the land of Aslan, the great lion who can warm the coldest heart and his arch-enemy, the White Witch. "Prince Caspian": Troubled times have come to Narnia and the evil King Miraz and his scheming Queen Prunaprismia have brought misery and an army of destruction to the peaceful land. Young Prince Caspian, rightful heir to the throne vows to save his kingdom and calls upon the aid of Peter, Susan, Edmund and Lucy. "The Voyage of the dawn treader": A new quest begins for Edmund and Lucy, who, with their horrible cousin Eustace, join King Caspian on a voyage to find seven missing Lords of Narnia. The Silver chair Old King Caspian's only son and heir, Prince Rillian has disappeared. The great lion, Aslan, calls on Jill and Eustace, guiding them in their search for the lost prince. On their perilous quest, the children meet up with Puddleglum who travels with them to the land of giants. Their search leads them to face the Green Witch, the Queen of the Deep Realm whose spell they must break. Each edition also available separately on VHS [301499], [301990], [302722].
